name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: Back in February, I went to a Bloomberg event in the suburbs, where a few dozen self-described moderates and former Republicans told me they prized stability and civility in politics.

But gun control was an issue that got them really riled up.

https://t.co/BH0uFInxCp

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Obama Makes Fear a Rallying Cry, by @mimbsy https://t.co/iPNVs4o5aT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: Here’s a photo from 2013, of the first real conversation Biden & Harris ever had, at a National AG Association meeting. They were brought together by Beau Biden—via the how the two AGs fought the Obama administration on the mortgage settlement. That story: https://t.co/v2ulx3f3H1 https://t.co/3LJBMTVRDG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The details in the 24-page indictment describe a scam that was almost comically flagrant," @russellberman reports: https://t.co/kOHjbveneI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Aedes aegypti mosquitoes are everywhere. @josh_sokol reports on how these pests cozied up to human civilization, and why understanding their evolution could help us stop them: https://t.co/83nSiYuhvk

text:

text: The Lonely Work of Performing Funerals in Lima, Peru via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/gBy7O6U4cG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris's 2011 fight against the big banks was a pivotal moment, defining her career and her relationship with Joe Biden, reports @IsaacDovere. https://t.co/ce3vxcXWOw

name: TheAtlantic
text: In theory medications should be given to patients when they're most needed. But that's not how hospitals work, writes @EmilyAnthes: https://t.co/AgiKpg2OjF

name: TheAtlantic
text: How Brayden, a 13-year-old who stutters, delivered the best speech of the Democratic National Convention, @JohnGHendy writes: https://t.co/zOflDPnyVy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Congress can find a way to dedicate relief funding to airlines and hospitals and oil companies, surely American politicians can appropriate targeted funds as a lifeline to struggling parents," @ehaspel writes: https://t.co/GirNjppCDZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Flooded Buddha, Tokyo Skytree, Damp Moose—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/mBQB72qvMC

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "It’s one thing to wake up every morning with a neurological disability and face your classmates. It’s another to address a national audience when you know what’s going to happen—that a particular letter or sound is coming down the line...." -- @JohnGHendy
https://t.co/HQGf696y0S

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: How can you create a sense of national unity in the face of divisive, polarizing propaganda? Here's how it's been done in Belarus  https://t.co/aZtyAy5pyA

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Though the Belarus protests are largely leaderless, one person has had an extraordinary impact: Stsiapan Sviatlou, a 22-year-old blogger who runs the movement's most popular Telegram channel.

@anneapplebaum has the story: https://t.co/VMf9xQdgPT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: I wrote about Brayden Harrington, whose stutter and poise took the air out of American living rooms tonight: https://t.co/epTs6FBZ3s

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Over the past 10 days, people all across Belarus have marched, protested, carried red and white flags and banners, and gathered at factories and outside prisons," @AnneApplebaum writes: https://t.co/6mT8IcoaeR

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden's specific plans for the economy weren't a focus of this week's convention. That could be risky for November, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/qGS9ecqWWV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The United States is forcing its citizens to bootstrap their way through a global catastrophe, saddling traumatized families with the burden of public administration and amplifying the country’s inequalities," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/QlDl2JWYJM

name: TheAtlantic
text: After Stacey Beehler had 10 miscarriages, her best friend, Debbie, offered to be her surrogate. Neither of them expected quadruplets. @julieebeck talks with Stacey and Debbie for The Friendship Files: https://t.co/hv78qu2weS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Biden seemed stiff during earlier appearances this week, but anyone who watched his acceptance speech saw a far more engaged and coherent speaker than Trump," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/6uS2PhkgRG
